about_the_game:
Olympia: Festival of the Gods is a digital board game where players collect tokens in order to perform rituals to honor the Gods of Ancient Greece! Players can compete against other players in local PVP, or against AI bots.

Note: Olympia: Festival of the Gods does not support online multiplayer at this time. This feature may be added in a future update.

HOW TO PLAY

The game is composed of 6 rounds. Each round honors a different Greek God or Goddess.

Each round is broken up into two phases: collecting, and scoring.

During the Collecting phase, players compete to collect their desired tokens. Players collect all of the tokens of the same color from either columns or the table. Tokens belonging to the God or Goddess that is being honored that round are "wild" allowing one additional token to be collected with any other tokens. But watch out for the Hades token at the table center -- collecting Hades will cost players valuable points!

During the Scoring phase, players use their tokens on ritual spaces at a God or Goddess's altar. Each ritual has a cost - the player must spend tokens of the designated color (or the wild color) to complete the ritual. Completing all of the rituals of a particular God or Goddess rewards the player with bonus points!
